reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award The Annual Regional Partnership Meeting under the Caribbean Plant Health Director’s Forum was an initiative that allows regional partners that interact in safeguarding activities in the Caribbean meet annually to discuss their works plans. This is done primarily to limit the duplication of efforts and the maximization the limited financial and technical resources available to the partners. Also, at this meeting the agenda for the next Caribbean Plant Health Directors Meeting is usually drafted. This initiative commenced in March 2013 and has since continued annually..

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS)
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Trinidad and Tobago is a leading economic force in the Caribbean and critical to regional energy security because of its well-developed oil and gas industry. Despite its relative wealth, Trinidad and Tobago suffers from high crime, underdevelopment, and pockets of significant poverty. U.S. assistance promotes the development of professional military and security forces to strengthen the rule of law, increase accountability and interagency security cooperation, and improve maritime and border security. Programs to advance citizen security through the Caribbean Basin Security Initiative complement and enhance U.S. bilateral assistance.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
